pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing suspension
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:0.4: 13. The second training rule on bad behavior
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:1.2: At that time the nun Thullanandā had been pressed by the Sangha. She then said to the nuns,
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:1.3: “But, Venerables, you should socialize. Don’t live separately.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:1.4: There are other nuns in the Sangha who have such behavior, reputation, and notoriety,  and who harass the Sangha of nuns and hide each other’s offenses. The Sangha says nothing to them.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:1.5: It’s because of disrespect, contempt, impatience, and slander, and because you are weak that the Sangha says to you, ‘Sisters, you socialize, behave badly, have a bad reputation, are notorious, harass the Sangha of nuns, and hide each other’s offenses. Be secluded, Venerables. The Sangha praises seclusion for the Sisters.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:1.6: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:1.7: “How could Venerable Thullanandā, after being pressed by the Sangha, say this to the nuns?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:1.11: “Is it true, monks, that after being pressed by the Sangha, the nun Thullanandā said this to the nuns?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:1.17: “… How could the nun Thullanandā, after being pressed by the Sangha, say this to the nuns?
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:1.21: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:1.22: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

Be secluded, Venerables. The Sangha praises seclusion for the Sisters,’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:1.27: then the nuns should correct her like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:1.30: There are other nuns in the Sangha who have such behavior, reputation, and notoriety, and who harass the Sangha of nuns and hide each other’s offenses. The Sangha says nothing to them.

Be secluded, Venerables. The Sangha praises seclusion for the Sisters.”’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:1.32: If that nun continues as before, the nuns should press her up to three times to make her stop.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:1.33: If she then stops, all is well.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:1.34: If she does not stop, then after the third announcement that nun too has committed an offense entailing sending away and suspension.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.7: There are other nuns in the Sangha who have such behavior, reputation, and notoriety, and who harass the Sangha of nuns and hide each other’s offenses. The Sangha says nothing to them.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.8: It’s because of disrespect that the Sangha … to you:

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.20: Be secluded, Venerables. The Sangha praises seclusion for the Sisters.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.44: “And, monks, she should be pressed like this.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.45: A competent and capable nun should inform the Sangha:
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.46: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.47: The nun so-and-so, after being pressed by the Sangha, says this to the nuns,

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.55: The Sangha praises seclusion for the Sisters.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.56: And she keeps on saying it.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.57: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should press her to make her stop.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.59: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.60: The nun so-and-so, after being pressed by the Sangha, says this to the nuns,
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.63: There are other nuns in the Sangha who have such behavior, reputation, and notoriety, and who harass the Sangha of nuns and hide each other’s offenses.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.64: The Sangha says nothing to them.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.65: It’s because of disrespect, contempt, impatience, and slander, and because you are weak that the Sangha says to you,
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.66: ‘Sisters, you socialize, behave badly, have a bad reputation, are notorious, harass the Sangha of nuns, and hide each other’s offenses.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.68: The Sangha praises seclusion for the Sisters.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.69: And she keeps on saying it.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.70: The Sangha presses her to make her stop.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.71: Any nun who approves of pressing her to make her stop should remain silent.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.72: Any nun who does not approve should speak up.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.73: For the second time I speak on this matter …
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.74: For the third time I speak on this matter …
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.75: The Sangha has pressed nun so-and-so to stop.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.76: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.77: After the motion, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.78: After each of the first two announcements, she commits a serious offense.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.79: When the last announcement is finished, she commits an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.80: For one who commits the offense entailing suspension, the offense of wrong conduct and the serious offenses are annulled.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.82: this is said with reference to the preceding offenses.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.84: there is an offense when she has been pressed for the third time, not as soon as the misconduct has been committed.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.86: she is sent away from the Sangha.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.88: only the Sangha gives the trial period for that offense, sends back to the beginning, and rehabilitates—not several nuns, not an individual nun. Therefore it is called an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.89: This is the name and designation of this class of offense. Therefore, too, it is called an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:3.1: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, and she perceives it as such, and she does not stop, she commits an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:3.2: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but she is unsure of it, and she does not stop, she commits an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:3.3: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but she perceives it as illegitimate, and she does not stop, she commits an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:3.4: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but she perceives it as legitimate, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:3.5: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:3.6: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, and she perceives it as such, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:3.8: if she has not been pressed;
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:3.11: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:3.12: The thirteenth offense entailing suspension is finished.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:3.14: “Venerables, the seventeen rules on suspension have been recited,
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:3.15: nine being immediate offenses, eight after the third announcement.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:3.16: If a nun commits any one of them, she must undertake the half-month trial period toward both Sanghas.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:3.17: When this is completed, she is to be rehabilitated wherever there is a sangha of at least twenty nuns.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:3.18: If that nun is rehabilitated by a sangha of nuns of even one less than twenty,
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:3.19: then that nun is not rehabilitated and those nuns are at fault. This is proper procedure.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:3.20: In regard to this I ask you,
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:3.26: You are pure in this and therefore silent. I will remember it thus.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:3.27: The group of seventeen is finished.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:3.28: The chapter on offenses entailing suspension in the nuns’ analysis is finished.
